channel.title: NPR All Things Considered
channel.description: All Things Considered hosts Ailsa Chang, Mary Louise Kelly, Ari Shapiro, Juana Summers and Scott Detrow present the program's trademark mix of news, interviews, commentaries, reviews, and offbeat features 7 days a week.

item.title: A new father finds comfort in a doctor's words of advice
item.description: In 2019, Darren Wayman was about to become a new father. He was terrified. Then, a doctor came into the delivery room and said something that changed his perspective on parenthood.

item.title: States with looser firearm laws saw a rise in gun-related deaths in kids, study shows
item.description: Children and teens in states with the most permissive gun laws are more likely to die in shootings than those in states with strict laws, a new study in JAMA Pediatrics shows.

item.title: Despite high stakes, some Iranians greet U.S. nuclear deal news with a shrug
item.description: President Trump has launched high-stakes talks with Iran over its nuclear program, but ordinary Iranians are unmoved.

item.title: Pakistan used Chinese weapons in its fight with India. The impact may be far-reaching
item.description: For the first time, a Chinese fighter plane made a debut in an active conflict. Pakistani pilots manned the Chinese J-10c during four days of clashes against India in May.

item.title: Grab your fishnets and cowboy boots for this queer line dancing night in NYC
item.description: Cowboy boots and fishnets might not feel like a natural pairing. But at this weekly queer line dancing night in New York City, that's almost the uniform.

item.title: Some states are seeing an increase in fraudulent odometer rollbacks on used cars
item.description: Looking to buy a used car? Check out the odometer. Some states are seeing an increase in fraudulent odometer rollbacks.

item.title: Country artist Orville Peck talks about hitting pause on his career to get sober
item.description: Orville Peck is a country music singer known for keeping some secrets -- performing under a stage name and a mask. He talked with Rachel Martin about hitting pause on his career to get sober.

item.title: Former CDC employees protest against dismantling of public health
item.description: Every Tuesday, protesters gather outside the CDC in Atlanta to point out possible public health dangers due to drastic federal cuts.

item.title: After 150 years, a J.M.W. Turner painting resurfaces
item.description: Lost and tucked away in a private collection for over 150 years, one of J.M.W. Turner's earliest oil paintings has been rediscovered.

item.title: Trump's efforts to cut National Parks budget faces bipartisan pushback
item.description: President Trump wants to cut hundreds of millions of dollars from the National Park Service budget this year and much more next year. The effort is facing bipartisan criticism.
